p: Diabetes mellitus is a grave metabolic disease worldwide that affects millions of people. Over 90% of diabetic cases fall on the spectrum of Type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), which is considered to be the dominating type of diabetes. Insulin resistance in T2DM causes impaired glucose tolerance and hyperglycemia. Diabetes is commonly treated with synthetic anti-diabetic agents that can provoke adverse side effects. In recent years, great attention has been paid to the anti-diabetic activity of dietary fiber [ 36].
